text: Shared bottle, aged in PUBR cellars. Hazy blaciksh pour with tan head. Nose was malt, cacaom light palate.

0.5 l bottle Systembolaget. Aroma is burned, roasted, some coffe, some liquorice and a little bit hops. Taste is roasted/burned malt with som coffe and chocolate. A nice long bitter aftertaste. A nice beer.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Dark with a medium size beige head, good lacing. Sweet chocolate aroma, dark bread and hay. Light and smooth mouthfeel, gentle carbonated. Sweet taste, milder chocolate taste than the aroma, black coffee, sweet dried figs with some woody and grassy notes.

Bottle shared at a tasting at tomers place. Thanks PMgep (Euro Secret Santa Summer 2015). Very dark brown, beige film. Malty and a little dry toast in the nose, dry, bitter, toasty and a little rye spiciness in the mouth. Medium body, fine fizz, dry, malty bitter finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks kerenmk. Clear reddish-brown with an off--white head. Aroma of caramel, roasted malt, toffee, dried fruits, nuts. Sweetish malt, toasted bread, caramel, chocolate flavors with hops bitterness in the background. Light-medium bodied, quite easy drinking. Decent.

At a tasting, thanks, small bubbly head, deep brown color, grainy dairy aroma with some charred wood, intens flavor of bittersweet chocolate, with earthy and smokey hints, mellow lingering bitterness. Quite nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting at tomers place. Thanks kerenmk. Dark brown. Aroma of caramel, toast, nuts and a bit of metal. Sweetish flavor, toasty, with a bit of caramel, some nuts, and a bitterish finish with a metallic hint. Medium-bodied.
Flaska från SB. Svart vätska med kaffegräddfärgat skum. Svag brödig doft. Stram och neutral beska. Helt ok men inte mer.

Bottle from Systembolaget Web Shop. Clear dark reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, roasted malt and licorice. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and roasted moderate bitter finish. 160715

Aromatiskt humlig doft. Inslag av choklad- och kaffetoner samt ingefära.
Mörk färg med dragning åt rubinröd. Ett tätt skum med bra hållfasthet. 
Ganska hårt rostad malt med dragning åt det lite rökiga hållet. Finns även lakrits och en mild choklad. 
Lätt munkänsla och kolsyra i överkant.
Eftersmaken bjuder en inte helt angenäm citrubeska.

Olmost black with a light brown head - Good malt aroma with hints of roasted malt - Good malt body with some notes of roasted malt and there is olso some notes of chocolate flavour with some bitterness - The malt goes into the finish and lingers for some time - This was good
Sample at SBWF 2014. Malty smell, bready with some toasted dark malts. Similar taste. Malty beer. Full taste.

Appearance: Transparent dark color with some ruby notes, and a nice beige head. Good lacing.Aroma: Dark malty, toffee and a bit roasted.Palate: Medium + body. Tad sweet with a mild bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Dark malt, toffee, bready and roasted.Overall impression: Quite nice schwarzbier. Starting to like this style.Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget web order, Sweden
Tried it bottled a couple of times. Dark and with a heavy aroma of burnt malts, coffee and chocolate some caramel and apricots.
Red brown color. Head completely disappears. Aroma of malt and coffee. Malty taste. Bitterness. Medium body.
Aroma of lager yeast and some bread. Taste is roast, bread and some caramel. Sligthly bitter.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 Hab das Bier im "Akkurat" in Stockholm getrunken. 
Ein sehr schön vollmundiges Bier mit schönen Röstmalzaromen. Ist schon fast etwas dickflüssig, der Schaum leicht braun und lange haltbar. Der Abgang ist langanhaltend und schön Röstmalz-schokoladig. 


Test vom 7.10.2007, Gebinde: Fass	Noten: 12,14,14,14,-,14 - 13,78
Sbwf 13.poured dark brown, thinbrown head. Heavy bready roasty aroma, sweetness.flavor has roasted malt, aniseed, bread, sweetness. Ok schwarzbier.

Dark brown, black. Dark roasty malts with a good deal of honey flavour. Lightish body, easy drink. Interesting honey / roasty combo though.
500 ml bottle. Dark ruby brown with thin tan head. Aroma bready and roasted, taste smooth, creamy, slightly roasted with faint bitterness.

Det är oklart om problemet är att det här är en mörk lager eller om det är en medelmåttig mörk lager. Det lutar åt det förstnämnda och i så fall kan Heaven slå sig lite halvlöst för bröstet. Om det är det här som serveras hos Sankte Per blir valet dock att ta en trappa ner när dagarna är räknade.

I understand where this beer gets its name from. It is absolutely divine. The scent is like floating in small clouds. The taste is like from another planet. The aftertaste is left for a while and tastes wonderful. I can not say any negative things about this beer. But buying this today. You will not regret you!

500ml bottle.
Deep mahogany brown, beige head.
Malty, toasted taste, chocolate, ash, licorice, hops, caramel.
Off-dry, medium body and bitterness, balanced CO2.
Malty, roasted taste, carael, hops, earth, chocolate. Quite nice.
 (2012-11-26)

500 ml can. 89810-01. BB 04/13. (Systembolaget) Östersund, Sweden.
Dark reddish brown colour with small light tan head.
Hops, mild bitterness, roasted malt and berries in aroma. Caramel sweetness too. Flavour is caramel malt, buttery sweetness, bitterish hops and some bitterness. Maybe a little bit too much diacetyl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Namnet känns som en klyscha av en klyscha och etiketten ser ut som ett samarbete mellan Samhall och en new age-förening (det sägs att det är två skilda saker, att det inte är en "kärt barn har många namn"-situation, men jag vet då inte). Ovidkommande petitesser? Ja, men det är den enda kritik jag har att komma med. Man tager vad man haver.

Bottle. (old notes)

Dark brown, almost black with a medium brownish head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, coffee and something sweet. Rather bitter and with a long aftertaste.
Bottle. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Malty aroma. Malty, smoky flavour.

Bottle.
Clear chestnut, almost black, with a big tanned compact head that leaves a crater in the glass.
Big sweet malty aroma with lots of chocolate, dark bread, syrup, butter, some sweet licorice and nice grassy hops.
Taste is sweet and rich with chocolate, crisp bread, caramel, coffee, berries, vanilla and a nice grassy bitterness.
Medium to bigger body with soft carbonation.
Very rich and nice and, like someone said, almost porter like.

On tap at Akkurat, Stockholm. Almost black color  with medium white head. Roasted malt, chocolate and coffee in aroma. Taste, coffee, chocolate, bitter hops, some fruits. Long bitter finish. Nice. Early rating from 7/2009.

Draught @ Man in the Moon, Stockholm. Rated on 14.05.2011
Aroma has roasted malt and some coffee. Flavour has roasted malt, some licorice, chocolate and coffee. Very good and tasty, more stout than schwartz.

Bottle @ Grövelsjöns Fjällstation. An old friend that has been absent for a while (at least in Stockholm). A huge beer. Big creamy head, off-white. Colour of deep read wine, almost black. Citrus aroma with malts lurking underneath. A lot of malt in the body with some caramel icing on top. Medium-small carbonation. A nicely balanced bitter ending. Delicious mouth-feel and entirely drinkable. As I said, an old friend.

Mörk, närmast svart. Stor doft av choklad och rostad malt. Smaken är fruktig med mycket choklad, rostade porterliknande syrliga toner, len, krämig och med en medelstor beska som avrundning. Välbalanserad, lättdrucken och ett öl som passar i många sammanhang. Konstigt att den inte ingår i systemets ordinarie sortiment. Svårt att tänka på någon bättre öl som liknar denna. Åtminstone ingen svensk.

Bottle 50 cl, Sir Winston, Östersund. Pours pitch black with a light brown head leaving lace. Aroma is roasted, malty, hay, smokey and fruity. Big roasted body; acidy, fresh, hoppy, fruity and slightly sweet flavor. Finishes bitter roasted.
Dark brown with a small tan head. Roasted malts, dry chocolate and a slight acidity. A little licorice and a light spicy hoppiness. Roasty bitter aftertaste.

Bottle at Oliver Twist, Stockholm.

Pours black with a beige head, very porter like.

Actualy there are some porterlike qualities to the taste as well,  rosted malts and some acidity.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2011 Bottle from SB östersun thx Markus cons 2011-01-15 Göteborg
AR: roated malt, some coffey, a bit green peppar, when poured some dried fruits -dadels
AP: dark brown body, light beige/brown dirty rocky head fluffy curtains
F: great bitterness, sour, roasted malt, some fruitiness in the background. But the sourness isnt good. Dont know if it was the brewers intation but on the other hand it might been a wee infection BB 2011-08.... new rating 3,2 new average 3,5!

Bottle.2008-09-12, Göteborg
AR: hops, roasted malts, red fruits
AP: pitch black body, wee of white head
F: hops, roasted malts, red fruits
Draught (Stockholm Beer Festival 2009) - Dark brown with lively carbonation. Fruity aroma with marzipan, raisins and caramel. Fruity taste with raisins, hops and some slightly roasted notes.
Brown colour tan head looks nice. Aroma is roasted but rather weak. Flavour is again roasted and sad to say a bit watery. Carbonation is lively.

(Bottle at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, on 2009-07-29) Deep dark brown and clear. Medium sized and long lasting tan coloured head. Liquorice, chocalate and roastedness in aroma. Medium bodied and dry palate with quite high carbonation. Malts, roastedness, ash, liquorice, chocolate and bitterness in taste. Roastedness and bitterness in aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2009 On tap at Bishops Arms, Karlstad. Pours a dark brown color with a nice head which remains until the beer is finished. Aroma is roasted with coffee, liquorice, a nice fruitiness and hints of smoke. Flavour is malty with lots of roasted notes, coffee, some light chocolate, and liquorice. A clear Jämtland fruitiness is also prominent. Mediumbodied on the palate, quite smooth. Drinkable and rather sessionable. 6/4/7/3/14=3,4

Rerate: A bit better this time. Very nice schwarz. 7/4/74/15=3,7

Draught @ STBOWF. Stockholm Beer Festival 2008, Sweden.Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, coffee, licorice notes, vanilla notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long to average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily and smooth, carbonation is soft. [270908]
50 cl bottle. Clear very dark red with plenty of thick tan head. Aroma is burnt/roasted and mild hops. Taste is also burnt or roasted with a long bitter aftertaste.

50 cl bottle - Dark brown with a brown, big and lasting head as with most schwarzbiers. Big fruity aroma with some hops. Roasty and almost smoked flavor combined with some mild hoppiness. Was expecting more from Jämtlands and its high ratings. More sweetness is to be desired.

Bottle from TBone, thanks!. Deep dark brown color. Mango, caramel and ginger in the aroma. Caramelly sweet flavor with mango, hints of ginger and carrot. Hint of salt in the aftertaste. Tasty dark lager.

Bottle, Oliver Twist, Stockholm, Sweden.  Rudy brown colored beer with a small creamy head that doesnt last well.  Nothing to speak of in the dull nose.  Faint smells.  Flavor is not flawed, but again very dull and doesnt provide much to describe.  Little mouthfeel.  A barely drinkable beer.

Bottle. Pours a black colour with a light beige head. Aroma is very malty with notes of liquorice, some chocolate, butter/diacetyl and a hint of hoppy freshness. Flavour is malty with loads of liquorice but also some chocolate and a coule of roasted coffee beans. The finish is a bit harsh with notes of coffee and with some bitterness. I found this beer a bit boring.

Bottle, bought @ YNWA, Kolding. 
[Vintage 2006 - BBE 05/07]
Pours a deep brown with a great creamy beige head. Great lacing. Aroma is mild chocolate, roasted malts and light hoppiness. Very nice, light and round mouthfeel. Flavour is greatly roasted with a good background of chocolate. Very well-rounded!

A nice locking beer deep brown/red almost black colored body with a light brown head.

The nose pickup roasted malt and light hops, flowery.

Taste of malt, roasted and chocolate flavors, followed by herbal bitterness of the hops, and at the very end, lingering dry bitterness with hints of roasted coffee.

A bit aggressive, but, jet fairly well balanced.

A nice beer, to bad its no longer available at any of my local systembolaget shops, I think this beer deserves shelf space.

Sampled on 2007-12-19, 500ml bottle.
Dark brown. Roasty nose, lots of chocolate and licorice. Wonderful flavour, unbelievably yummy. Richly hoppy with notes of chocolate and slightly licoricy.

50cL bottle, courtesy of omhper.  Thanks, Per!  Pours a very deep dark mahogany color; bright off-white head with creamy, medium-sized bubbles (almost like milk froth) with textured, thin lacing.  Plenty of nougat and lightly roasted malts in the aroma; cocoa powder and chocolate; sweet without being sticky.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: plenty of cocoa and milk chocolate and nougat; a warm vanilla note permeates the mid-palate, with a bready note, and slight citrus adding some nice acidity.  Lengthy, doughy and vanilla finish; ends quite soft (think: cloud).

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2008 Bottle. Deep brown color with a beige head. Aroma of roasted/burned malt, chocolate, toffee, and coffee. Tastes of roasted and sweet malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel and a bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. A bit similar to a stout/porter.

Considering the style, Scores ranging from 1 to 5, 5 being the most intense

Appearance:
Body: &nbsp Clear(1)->Murky(5) : 4 &nbsp  &nbsp  Light Brown(1)->Pitch Black(5) : 4 &nbsp &nbsp Still(1)->Sparkling(5) : 3

Head: &nbsp None(1)->Large(5) : 5 &nbsp  Off-White(1)->Dark Brown(5) : 2 &nbsp  Lasting: 5 &nbsp Lacing : 5 &nbsp Nitro : XX

Aroma:
Intensity : 4 &nbsp

Hops : 3 &nbsp Noble(1)->American(5) : 2 &nbsp Leafy : XX &nbsp Floral : 3  &nbsp Lemon/Lime : XX &nbsp Grapefruit : XX  Orange : XX  &nbsp Herbal : 2 &nbsp Pine/Spruce/Resin : XX

Palate:
Light(1)->Full(5) : 5 &nbsp Flat(1)->Fizzy(5) : 3 &nbsp Clean : 5 &nbsp Sharp : XX &nbsp Watery : XX &nbsp  Oily : XX &nbsp Chalk : XX &nbsp Astringent : XX &nbsp Alcohol : XX &nbsp Mineral : XX &nbsp Oxidation : XX &nbsp Metallic : XX

Comments: Huge stunning mountainous head. Grainy, well toasted, mild coffee-like, chocolate icing reminiscent, profound beer that, as Jamtlands always does, goes beyond stylistics definition. Sweet and dry, sweet and dry, its a switch. Medium vanilla undertones all along. No sourness. Very full-bodied. Complex and hugely drinkable. Even goes further with swift, enclosing floral and herbal hoppy undertones. Fresh and vibrant, I believe this may very well be my favourite Swedish beer.

50cl bottle from systembolaget.   Dark brown with ruby edges and a small, dying cream head.   Aroma of roasty and burnt malts, brown sugar, strawberry and chocolate.   Flavor is both fruity and burnt with a bitter finish and nice hop spice.   full malt profile and smooth crisp balance.   Body is full but not thick, fizzy but smooth.   Good balance to Hell, but I didnt enjoy it as much as Hell was simply outstanding for its style.

A very good Shwartz, thanks to Abusmaster.  With roasted graininess and creaminess, and a moderate malty aroma and good laciness.  Brown with white head.Secondary chocolate and coffee/postum.  A great session at 5%.  Smooth drinking. Medium mouthfeel.
Bottle at home ... Deep brown ... smokey roast malts ... smooth roast malts again some tobbaco and coffee
Brown dark redish body. Begie head. Aroma brings toffee, coffee and malt. Flavor is malty, butter and coffee.
Draught.  Small and quickly disappearing off-white head. Clear dark red brown body. Caramel coffee aroma. Coffee hops flavor in a very good balance. Low carbonation. Long burned malt aftertaste.

very dark copper colour. big brownish and solid head. intensive smell of roasted malts, herbs and fruits. begins roasty and with ale-like bitterness. aromes of herbs, coffee and chocolate. mid is milder and more hopsy at the same time. spicy finish. hops, bitter chocolate and coffee.
Bottle at NB-ØLlandskamp. Dark red/black - offwhite head. Burned, burned malts, dry burned, roasted, licorice, light sweetness, nice bitterness. Dry bitter finish.
Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown colour. Roasty sweet caramel malty aroma. Soft roasty bit creamish malty caramel flavour with a pleasant bitter hoppiness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Twist in Stockholm: Roasted aroma with some hoppiness from the beige head. Smooth roastiness with a creamy mouthfeel followed by thin feeling hops. Does well by me for a style I dont particularly fancy.

Dark black little reddish body with a brownish creamy head.
Sweet aroma of coffe and choklate with small notes of roasted malt.
Flavor of roasted malt, coffe, chokalate. Has a roasted aftertast.
Palate is medium thick and dry feels little like milk.

Small beige lasting head. Dark reddish brown ale. Very little aroma; faint maltiness. Sweetish-dry peppery roasted malt taste with fantastic clarity. Light mouthfeel. Dry, burnt aftertaste, slightly dusty. Very nice. An excellent lager. (0.25l draft at Akkurat.)

This one seemed a bit skunked.  Not a whole lot of anything going on here.  Quite drab and boring.  I also remain skeptical that this is even a schwarzbier as I get some certain esters and fruity character.  No doubt a flaw.  In addition, the unique roasted malt character indicative of the style remains docile and submissive.  Odd sweetness to it as well.  "Heaven"???  More like purgatory.

Bottle, BB 05/07, thanks to lagomswedish!  Poured a clear, deep garnet with about an inch of creamy deep beige head.  Aroma was of sweeter chocolates and darker fruits with an interesting herbal grainy twist to it.  More chocolate than the nose.. lightly-roasted and rather tasty.. back-end had lots of sweet, tacky notes that became a bit cloying.. sticky, super-sweet chocolate finish.  Did I mention that this was sweet?  OK feel, but came across as powerfully OK.

50 cl bottle. Tasted at home. No yeast at the bottom. Reddish dark brown colour with a nice fine head. Light aroma of roastedness, maltness and little fruit. Very tasty flavour with notes of roasted malt, and with a sour touch, maybe from the roasted malt. Very dry at the end, but well balance between the hops and thr roasted finish.

Bottle. Large creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Fair lacing. Dark mahogany color. Butter, caramel, brown sugar, liquorish and burned notes. Medium bodied with a soft carbonation. Light to moderated malty burned bitterness. At the same time some sweet flavor that balance this beer. Light bitter burned finish.
Bottle. Dark brown with hints of red, huge beige head. Fruity, roasted, malty aroma with earthy and citrusy hops. medium bodied. Flavour is overwhelmingly bitter with an acidic touch.

500ml bottle sampled at Finns. Ruby-black body. Missing head. Malty aroma mixed with a citrus touch. Mellow fruity flavour offset by firm liquorice and caramel notes. Roasted bitter ending. Moderate carbonated. Well balanced (23.02.2007).
Bottle 0,5l. Deep red brown coloured. A fluffy white head. A rich fruity aroma with hints of coffee. A balanced flavor where roasted malts dominates, A dry bitter and fruity finish.
Bottle. Red brown colour with a stable beige head. Aroma is roasted with tones of sour milk and caramel. Slightly sour flavour, roasted and a bit grassy. Quite short finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2007 Bottle... Very dark, burnt orange lager with a mid-sized, frothy, khaki head. Excellent retention. Understated aroma with afterthoughts of chocolate and smoke. Hearty, but nondescript flavor for the most part... other than some light roastiness. Leans a touch on the bitter side of balance. Medium-bodied with a whole milk mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Lengthy, medium bitter finish. Thanks go out to marsiblursi for providing the bottle!
Bottled. Almost black in colour with a rather large brownish head. Roasted and malty with notes of coffee and chocolate. Somewhat dry and hoppy finish.
rbesg, on tap at plain kitchen. dark and almost black with a light beige head. rubbery cocoa aroma, mellow but not that exciting, would like a bit more hop action
bottle. dark brown color. medium creamy head. roasty chokolate and liqerice in taste and aroma. bit smokey. quite ok.

Almost black with a nice head. The aroma is malty. The flavour is like the name: Heaven. It has notes of roasted malt, flower, a bit of chocolate and smoke - all accompanied by a nice bitterness, that lasts all the way through. A really delicious schwartzbier - yummi...

50 cl bottle courtesy of Marsiblursi. The aroma is lightly roasted, perfumey and licorice heavy. The body is a dark ruddy brown and the head is frothy, two fingers thick, lasting and a nice tan color.

Big licorice fore gets almost salty and gamy tasting at times. Molasses, anise way too much roastiness to be a real Schwarzbier. It is nice though. Enjoyable to drink if a little smokey/gamy at first....but that fades and it is mostly a licorce/anise acented beer with some mild chocolate notes and just a hint of saltiness in the finish.
0,5 l bottle. Dark reddish brown color with creamy head. Soft roasted and nutty aroma with licorice notes. Dry and salty charcoal flavor, firm hop flavor and bitterness.

Jämtland show again that lager can be great. Pitch dark, milk chocolate head, full hoppy dryness that lingers for a long time.Fine for sipping, great with food. Not for novices, perhaps.
Id love to have the Jämtland beers available in Norway!
Bottle. Red brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, toasted, fruit. Flavour is chocolate, fruit, coffee, hop.

Bottled. Clear, deep reddish-brown with a beige head. Fruits, hops, pine-notes, chocolate, licorice and some roasted notes in the aroma. The flavor is roasted, with coffee, hops and fruityness. Medium body and a coffee-bitter finish. Quite dryish in the mouth. (061013)

500 ml bottle. Dark brown, almost black, and with a beautiful ruby red hue. Throws a tall light brown head that clings to the glass. Roasted barley aroma with a dry dose of dark chocolate coffee. Smells like a stout. Flavour is also very dry and very roasted. This is a stout to me - and surely not a schwarzbier as there is way too much roastedness. Dryish bittering hops, and little, if no, aroma hops. Dry roasted finish.
[draught at Plain Kitchen] Roasted malt, resinous hops notes, some chocolate. full bodied, dry and bitter, nice.

Almost black with a brown head, fantastic lacing. Aroma is very much dominated by roast malts, but has a creamy chocolate smell to it too. The body is quite sweet, and again the flavour is driven by heavy roast malt. There is also some coffee and brown sugar flavours. Carbonation was light. Finish is a little bittersweet.
Aroma gives more hops than expected with some serious chocolate notes. Taste is similar with alot of bitterness in the finish.
A very nice dark lager. Color is dark redish brown with a thick beige foam. A smooth brew with chocolate notes and a good bitter aftertaste.

Dark brown body, beige big bubbled head; Huge nose, complex but lacks depth, pleasant mix of milk chocolate, allspice, cinnamon; Soft texture, very soft, big carbonation, balanced bitter body; Quite long a little bitter finish with soft aromas of chocolate and cinnamon.

Didnt take any notes so this is from what I seem to recall. Pours up very dark with thin brownish head. Aroma is rosted barley and chocolate. Taste is chocolate and oragane peel. Quite well hopped. Lovely.

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2007 First rating50 cl bottle from Swedish Systembolaget. Clear dark red color, big creamy beige head. Chocolate and a bit orange scent, hoppy as well. Big body and bitterness. Chocolate malt and hoppy taste. Chocolate and bitter aftertaste.8/4/8/4/17=4.1Second rating(Cask at Akkurat, STockholm)Dark red brown color, tan to brown head. Smooth roasted scent. Roasted and fruity taswte with a bitter finish. Smooth mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.7/4/7/4/15=3.7
A nice dark lager, with lots of koffee bitternes and sweety dark chocolate. A good dark lager, I like it!

Bottle at Reading 2006 (Sunday) - thanks Duff. Dark, almost black with ruby hues when held to light. The mosty malty aroma is masked by lots of carbon dioxide coming off it. To taste this is sweet caramel and malt with restrained fruit character. A beer that is extremely easy to drink.

This bottled brew sampled at Dicks Bodacious Bar-B-Que RB event poured a small sized head of finely sized light brown colored mostly diminishing bubbles that left a poor lacing and a semi-opaque dark ruby red brown colored body.  The aroma was sweetly malty.  The mouth feel contained a mild malt bit but was otherwise unnoted.  The flavor contained notes of this sweet malt and mild brown malts.

Bottle. Small tan head that quickly dissipated, poor lacing, transparent, minimal carbonation, and a red brown hue. Nose was malty, chocolate, coffee, and smoke. Flavor was malty, chocolate and smokey. Tingly palate. Light-medium body.

(Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm) Colour is dark brown, almost black with firm off-white head. Nose is malty, roasted with lots of chocolate, black coffee and hops. Taste is roasted, dry and fruity with chocolate, liquorice and a hoppy, bitter finish. Brilliant!

Sample at Indy tasting Dicks BBQ 3/31/06 - thanks MrWalker - Aroma is roasted dark malts and smoke.  Pours cloudy dark brown with small head and good lacing.  Flavor is roasted dark malts, chocolate, earthy, and smokey.  Palate is sticky.  Tasty brew.  I may have to dig into the style a bit more.

500 ml bottle, via MrWalker.  Clear brown body with chestnut highlights.  Fluffy one inch light brown head with nice retention.  Chocolate malt nose with some nuttiness and a lighter note of roasted malt.  Alot of chocolate malt on the flavor as well, with a finish that leans to the astringent burnt malt side with hints of smoke.  Moderate bitterness in mid swallow and finish.  Light to medium bodied with moderate carbonation, thinning a bit on the finish.  A nice enjoyable beer, not overly complex on the flavor, but certainly interesting enough to seek out if youre a fan of Schwarzbiers.

Bottle, at home.
Black with light brown head, almost diminishing, good lacings. Aroma moderate malty (burnt) and hoppy (flowers). Flavor moderate sweet and bitter, long duration. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonated

Dark brown colour with a longlasting tan head. Roasted malt in the aroma. Hints of caramel and hops too. Lots of roasted taste and hints of chocolate. But lots of bitterness in the flavor aswell. A very nice one.

Light chocolate and roasted malt nose, dark brown color, foamy low head Quick sweet taffee malt, peaty undertones. A little butterscotch is unfortunate in the middle. Powerful woody, roasted grain end. Lingering coffee-like bitter in the sides of the mouth. Medium body, metallic mouth feel. Big punch at first then a long tapering profile.

Uhhhh  Secret Santa Jonas - that was over yummie, thanks a lot: Nice dark brown color with some red bling bling. Small layer of a fizzy head. Nice malt, caramel and toffee nose. Toasted malt taste with caramel and nicely spicing up traces of coffee and cardamon. Dry finish - very nice.

Aroma of roasted malts and  bitter chocolate. Very dark brown beer with red tones. Head is beige and creamy, not long lasting. Flavour is sweet and filled with bitter chocolate. Finish is dry, with good cleansing bitterness. Soft on the palate, a bit watery body. Even though it is bottom-fermented, it tastes more like a decent porter than a schwartzbier

Keg @ Stockholm Beer Festival 2005To me its more a dark lager than a schwartzbier. Very dark, lots of roasted character but still lets the hops through. Refreshing for a dark beer like this. NIce aftertaste.

Bottled. Dark reddish brown colour. Beige, small head. Chocolatey, caramelly aroma. Roastmalty, bitterchocolatey taste. Not very hoppy for the style. Medium bitter and roasty finish. Mediumbodied. A great, though untypical schwarzbier. Thanks to MrWalker for this nice treat.
Bottled(500ml). -dark brown colour with a lasting brown foamy head, a bit too sweet just like Hell, strong malty and slightly floral aroma with caramel and chocolate notes, nice bitter finish

(Bottle 50 cl) "Hell" was a pale beer so this "Heaven" sgotta be black? Somehow I wouldve expected things the other way around. Anyways, this really is pitch black with a small light brown head. Dry and bitter with a lovely hoppy aroma and an almost absent sweetness. A bit too ashy for my liking. 260405

Poured a reddish mahogany color with a thin, off white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of smoke, caramel, and roasted malts.  Chocolate, light roast, toffee, some citrus hoppiness, and a light bitterness in the finish.
Draught at Oliver Twist. Dark reddish brown coloured. Very malty and slightly fruity with notes of chocolate. Smooth mouthfeel. Very nice.
Dark brown colour with a tan head. Hoppy aroma with a coffe note. Roasted malty flavor with some chocolate bitterness.

Bottle. Hoppy, very dusty aroma. Also fruity, roasted malts. Almost black colour with a red hue. Small unstable, light brown head. Very malty and quite roasted flavour, but still mild. Aftertaste has some roasted barley bitterness. Quite nice, semi-smooth mouthfeel.

Bottled.
Dark brown coloured with a small off white head.
Aroma of coffee and nuts with hoppy notes.
Flavour of chocolate with roasted notes and notes of coffee.

(on bottle)Clear, very dark brown with a beige head. very sweet, almost cloying molassses and canesugared sent. watery and burnt taste with a coffeeish finish. The best part of this beer seems to be the very long finish, with notes of rom and raisins
Pours dark brown mahogany, with a thick beige head. Hoppy, buttery nose. Smooth, rounded flavour from dark chocolate, toffee and hops. Great bitterness in the finish. Full bodied.

Almost black color with a small head. Body is medium to light. Taste is coffee and roasted malts with a bit of dare I say hoppiness? Somehow, its just a bit tart. Carbonation is a bit crisp but the flavors dont meld all that well.

Bottle. Dark brown with bubbly beige head. Packed to the brim! Malt, coffee, dark chocolate, leather, vegemite, chalky (do not want to steal duffs ashtray/charcoal - but thats more it!), dry and bitter finish. Full, fluffy(?) mouthfeel. I love it - must be one of the best bottom-fermented beer Ive ever had.
Bottel. Black with ligth brown disapering head. Mild but dark taste with good aftertaste with hints of coffee, roasted malts and a dry/bitter after taste.
Bottle from Ølbutikken. Brown colour with a medium baige head. Light roasted fruity malty and hoppy aroma and a sweet dry roasted fruitz light bitter taste. Medium bodz and a drz finish.

Bottle. The liquid is clear; the colour is very deep wine red. The compact, finger-thick foam is beige and firm.

The smell is dominated by a fruity flavour of cascade hops, but there are also notes of burned malt, toffee and diacetyl. 

The carbonation is fresh with small bubbles.

The taste is rather complex with notes of burned malt and a solid bitterness and a fruity body. The finish is balanced with notes of black coffee and a fine fruity sweetness.

I like!
Bottled. Black/dark brown opaque, decent brown head. Malty and a bitter hoppy aroma. Bitter hoppy taste with roast coming in strong. Aftertaste is more bitter than the bitterness while drinking it.

Bottled (BB 04/2005)
Almost opaque dark ruby, creamy expresso head. Aroma has roast, cold coffee and hints of hops. Medium to full bodied, lots of roast with hints of sugar. Bitter finish. There is just something plastic in the palate which prevents this to being an excellent.

Dark brown opaque body topped with a lasting beige creamy head. Nice malty aroma with strong roasted coffee hints. Well-balanced taste dominated by the coffeeish flavor. Strong bitter finish. If this is the beer they drink in Heaven, then I hope Ill get up there when I die!

Almost black colored with mild red tones. Hoppy, bitter and dry aroma with some sweet caramel tones, maybe some herbs come up too. Flavor is rich with roasted coffee, herbs and endig turns out to be strongly dry, herbal taste giving nice character. Good brew, still expected more out of this.

(Bottled) very dark brown-red color with a medium, tanned head. Roasted, quite dry aroma, but with some caramely-plummy maltiness and moderate hopping. Very roasted-malty, but still quite dry and ashy flavor. Smooth, chalky, medium-bodied palate. A tasty and quite complex dunkel.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2005 Bottle - re-rated, and glad I did
Godd complex aroma: Pine, Marzipan, roses and milk chocolate.
Dark chestnut colour, tanned creamy head.
Milk chocolate, burned, strawberry minerals and slightly ashen notes dominate the flavor. Medium body.

Fruity vinuous sweet nose, malts, and tangy hops. Smoky, roasted dimension, too. Dark black with tan foamy lacing head. Medium body with light carbonation. Starts with subtle chocolate sweetness, roasted malts, light sour. Finish is smooth malts. After is roased bitter.

Dark dark ruby red with small beige head. Strong sweet fruity mollases aroma. Low sweetness super mouth drying palate. Medium bitter roasted malts flavours, with hint of floral honey  flavours. Definitive smokey super roasted dry finish. Intriuging"

Dark red-amber colouredbeer with a small head. Slightly roasted malty, molasses aroma. Roasted malty taste with a dry light bitter burned smoky finish. A nice and interesting beer but I would not drink a lot of it.
Smokey malty and rubbery aroma. Nothing special. Some tea-leaves in flavour and finish. Not very nice.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2004 Sampled from draught at Stockholm Beer & Whisky Festival 2004 (#50).Dark brown beer with a fine brown head. Sweet and full aroma of malt, chocolate and caramel with creamy and Jämtland yeasty notes. Mostly sweet in the flavor, roasted malty with spice, hop and fruit. Tasty and well-balanced and really smooth. A beer I could drink again and again.

Bottled: Deep burgundy coloured. Ligth brown medium lasting head. Chocolate, hops and fruit in the aroma. Hops, fruit, light yeast notes and some chocolate notes in the flavour. Has a nice lasting bitterness in the end.

dark ruby-brown colour, fine head and a nice lace, malt, chocolate and ginger in the nose, slightly roasted, creamy mouthfeel,medium-bodied, robust bitterness in a long nutty finish - deeply balanced and very well-made; thanks to fiulijn for this one

Very dark colour, nearly black; dark greige-brown head, fast dissipating. Very (dark)bready, chocolate & varnish nose. Bread aroma gets more burnt - Maillard? Dry, bitterish taste. Grainy flavours like specific dark grains, roaste barley or oats; slight acidic finish included. Bit smoked too. Mouthfeel bit thinnish, unlike all the grainy flavours would suggest. Good dark bottom-fermenting beer. 'Starkol' is Scandinavian perception. Big thanks to Bjorn & Anders for the Jämtlands choice.
Probably one of the best beers I know. Felt like an old friend the first time i drank it.
Mossy, grapefruit aroma. Roasted wood, charcoal and chocolate flavor. Full & warming. A bit watery.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2005 (Stockholm Beer Festival 2003)
Dark with a brownish head. Aroma is wonderful from toffee and butter. Flavor is sweet and malty. Very nice.

Dark-brown, almost black a good nut-brown head. Aroma of loads of dark burnt malt, black coffee and some bitterness. Taste is vert malty and hoppy in big black body. Strong notes of dark chocolate, black coffee and burnt malt. Bitter grapefruit bitterness. Long dry finish.
A little spicy, roasted and licorice aroma. Ruby color, light brown head, good lace. Starts ligh sweet, flowery, light body, light roasted. Bitter and coffee finish.

A deep red beer with a beutiful lasting light brown head. The aroma is fruity and hoppy. THe flavor is slightly sweet from a good maltblend - a little watery in the middle but with a good smoked bitter finish. An OK stout.

Nice, thick head.
A burnt aroma with toffee-touch.
A lot of flavour and bitterness, with a long taste.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2004  Bottled.  
Dark brown. Roasty nose, lots of chocolate and licorice. Wonderful flavour, unbelievably yummy. Richly hoppy with notes of chocolate and slightly licoricy.
UPDATED: AUG 8, 2003 Almost black, thin delicate head, robust malt character. Nice bitter hops all around. The name says everything. (Rerate Overall +2 (I surrender, it's beautiful)).
Perfect schwarz - delicate, rich und malty. The champion beer of Stockholm beer festival 2000 (the best draught).

Dark amber, with red shades; thin collar. Big aroma: malt, roasted malt, porto wine, liquorice. Also very good body character, malt, roasted malt, some fruitness; well round. Finishes with a well hopped and roasted malt final. Really an interesting one.
Dark auburn color, topped off with a tan head.  Sweet malty aroma rounded by notes of chocolate.  Nice malty backbone, finished nicely bitter.
Coffee, chocolate and more coffee. Darkest brown, fair toffee head. Roasted malt flavour, good bitterness follows. Complex, feels like a Belgian. Smooth, with hints of fruit and nuts. Fabulous Beer!
RateBeer Summer (Toronto) 02: IMHO one of the best beers at RateBeer 02.  Molasses aroma with some deep hops, brown color, super long aftertaste.  Very bold and complex.  An aptly named brew.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2005 Red-brown with dense beige head.
Citrus aroma with notes of sweet malt. Roasted notes. Chocolate, müsli, hops and spices.
Malty flavor with notes of müsli, licorice and chocolate. Burnt and dry with firm bitter finish.
Very nice brew. Burnt coffe nose and also quite a hoppy aroma aswell. Very ashtray, charcoal, burnt coffee flavour, pretty good stuff, also nice hoppy bitterness, i really dug this stuff.
Very bitter and very roasted, somewhat unbalanced. I prefer Hell!
Round - drinkable - its bitterness should be better balanced though...
Transparently black with a big creamy head. Medium body, somewhat roasty, with big, very bitter citrusy hop profile.
Very robust.  Loads of malt-toffee flavour, slight raisin-nutbread notes.
